Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.threading

Class KivaKitThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
        • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.threading.KivaKitThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operation, Startable, Stoppable, Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, Named, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RepeatingKivaKitThread
    public class KivaKitThread
extends BaseRepeater
implements Startable, java.lang.Runnable, Stoppable, Named
    A thread with methods to start, pause, resume and stop (pause and resume are implemented only in RepeatingKivaKitThread). KivaKit threads have a uniform naming convention with each thread name prefixed with "KivaKit-". KivaKitThreads are Repeaters and can broadcast messages to interested Listeners.

    Thread Lifecycle States

    During the lifecycle of a KivaKit thread, it transitions from one KivaKitThread.State to another as code executes and methods are called to control execution. These states are managed with a StateMachine, which enables state transitions and allows specific states to be waited on. The method state() gives access to the StateMachine and the convenience methods waitFor(State) or waitFor(State, Duration) allow states to be waited for. In lifecycle-order, thread states are:

    • KivaKitThread.State.CREATED - This thread has been created but is not yet waiting
    • KivaKitThread.State.WAITING - This thread is waiting for the prescribed initial delay before running
    • KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING - This thead is now running user code
    • KivaKitThread.State.PAUSE_REQUESTED - This thread has been asked to pause
    • KivaKitThread.State.PAUSED - This thread is paused
    • KivaKitThread.State.RESUME_REQUESTED - This thread has been asked to resume
    • KivaKitThread.State.STOP_REQUESTED - This thread has been requested to stop
    • KivaKitThread.State.RAN - This thread is about to exit
    • KivaKitThread.State.EXITED - This thread has exited

    Properties

    • daemon(boolean) - Makes this thread a daemon if true, must be set before the thread is started
    • highPriority() - Makes this thread high priority
    • initialDelay(Duration) - Sets a delay that should pass before this thread starts to execute user code
    • lowPriority() - Makes this thread low priority
    • startedAt() - The time at which this thread transitioned to KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING
    • state() - The current state of the thread as a StateMachine that can be waited on
    • thread() - The underlying Java thread object

    Checks

    • isRunning() - True if this thread is in KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING
    • #stopRequested() - True if this thread has been asked to stop. This method should be called periodically in the user code being executed by this thread. That code should return if this method returns true to ensure that the Stoppable.stop() operation is responsive

    Operations

    • start() - Starts this thread, transitioning it to KivaKitThread.State.WAITING and then KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING
    • startSynchronously() - Starts this thread and waits for it to reach KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING
    • interrupt() - Interrupts this thread
    • Stoppable.stop() - Asks this thread to stop by transitioning to the KivaKitThread.State.STOP_REQUESTED state, causing the method #stopRequested() to return true. When user code checks this value, it should return, causing the thread to exit.
    • stop(Duration) - Asks this thread to stop and waits for up to the given duration for it to reach KivaKitThread.State.EXITED
    • waitFor(State) - Waits for the given KivaKitThread.State
    • waitFor(State, Duration) - Waits for up to the given maximum duration for this thread to reach the given KivaKitThread.State

    Overrides

    • onWaiting() - Called when a thread is started and is in KivaKitThread.State.WAITING
    • onRun() - Overridden to provide user code to execute if KivaKitThread(String, Runnable) was not called to provide user code
    • onRunning() - Called when a thread transitions to KivaKitThread.State.RUNNING
    • onRan() - Called when a thread reaches KivaKitThread.State.RAN and is about to exit
    • onExited() - Called when a thread has reached KivaKitThread.State.EXITED
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    Startable, Runnable, Pausable, Stoppable, Repeater
